title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is the short title of this Act. It transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transfers the authority to conduct the census to the Secretary of Agriculture. Section 526 of the Revised Statutes is amended to require the Secretary to conduct a census of agriculture every 5 years, with data collected relating to the previous year. Non-compliance with the census may result in penalties under title 13, United States Code. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transfers census authority to the Secretary of Agriculture. Each census under this subsection includes various states and territories under U.S. jurisdiction. Failure to disclose a social security number in response to a census request is not a violation. The Secretary of Commerce may provide information collected under title 13, United States Code to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture must also provide information collected in a census to the Secretary of Commerce upon request. The Secretary of Commerce can share census information collected under title 13, United States Code with the Secretary of Agriculture. Any information provided must only be used for statistical purposes. Rules for implementation can be set by the respective Secretaries. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code is repealed as of October 1, 1998. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code is repealed, and section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include reference to section 526(c) of the Revised Statutes. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. The amendment allows for the furnishing of information to the Department of Agriculture and Commerce under specific sections of the United States Code and the Food Security Act of 1985. It also addresses the confidentiality of information provided. The amendment allows for the release of information under specific sections of the United States Code and the Food Security Act of 1985. Information provided shall be treated as confidential for purposes of certain sections of title 13, United States Code. The House of Representatives passed the amendment on July 22, 1996.
